messages: 3b14b636129945831fcfcc7294686653 (21:33): is there any way to add focus/blur events to custom objects?
3b14b636129945831fcfcc7294686653 (21:33): for instance, to get a blur event on a div for someone clicking on some other form element?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:36): can someone with IE let me know what IE does for http://software.hixie.ch/utilities/js/live-dom-viewer/saved/647 ?

a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (21:36): 3b14b636129945831fcfcc7294686653: var div = document.getElementsByTagName("div")[0], form = document.getElementsByTagName("form")[0]; form.addEventListener("blur", function(e){div.dispatchEvent(e);}, false);
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (21:37): 3b14b636129945831fcfcc7294686653: Or something like that?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:37): so far i have three browsers with three different results
3b14b636129945831fcfcc7294686653 (21:37): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: in other words, currently only form elements or something containing them gets key presses and focus/blur events right?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (21:37): 3b14b636129945831fcfcc7294686653: Oh, that'll throw
3b14b636129945831fcfcc7294686653 (21:38): can I get a div to accept focus & key events?

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:38): 3b14b636129945831fcfcc7294686653: per the spec, all kinds of elements can be focusable, see http://www.whatwg.org/specs/web-apps/current-work/complete/editing.html#focus-management

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:38): 3b14b636129945831fcfcc7294686653: plus you can be "specially focusable" http://www.whatwg.org/specs/web-apps/current-work/complete/editing.html#specially-focusable
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:39): it strikes me that contenteditable isn't on either of those lists
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:39): but that would also make something focusable
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:39): probably
3b14b636129945831fcfcc7294686653 (21:39): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: so if I have some random div in the middle of my page, can I make it focusable?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:39): sure, just set tabindex=0 on it
3b14b636129945831fcfcc7294686653 (21:39): (or perhaps an SVG shape that I want to be selectable)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:40): SVG probably has an attribute like fcFocusableElementActivationBehaviorMatrix="focusable-element"
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:40): but i wouldn't know what it was off-hand
3b14b636129945831fcfcc7294686653 (21:41): I can't just set tabindex on it?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:41): dunno if SVG has tabindex
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:41): maybe
3b14b636129945831fcfcc7294686653 (21:41): aha! "focusable"
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (21:41): wow that's remarkably succint
3b14b636129945831fcfcc7294686653 (21:42): and the associated event is apparently "DOMFocusIn"
3b14b636129945831fcfcc7294686653 (21:44): I wonder if any browsers support that
3b14b636129945831fcfcc7294686653 (21:52): sorry for the obvious questions, but what exactly is the relation of svg tiny 1.2 to svg 1.2, and what specs are browsers trying to implement?
3b14b636129945831fcfcc7294686653 (21:57): or are browsers just shooting for svg 1.1?
3b14b636129945831fcfcc7294686653 (21:57): (which doesn't include this keyboard stuff as far as I can tell)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:06): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: i'm completely confused by http://www.w3.org/Bugs/Public/show_bug.cgi?id=9843
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (22:16): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: the patch that landed in Gecko makes document.written scripts not block on style sheets. seems to match IE
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:17): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: i don't think we should be adding things that make document.write('foo') work differently than data:text/html,foo
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (22:18): at least not without clear compat need
